clinical_study.brief_title: Validation of a Scale of Self-assessment of Fear Faces in Children 4 to 12 Years
clinical_study.official_title: Validation of a Scale of Self-assessment of Fear Faces in Children 4 to 12 Years: Scary Scale

brief_summary.textblock: Since the 2000s, the experiences of children and especially their fear during a consultation, a treatment or examination is food for thought in our establishment. There is no tool validated self-assessment of fear to 6 faces. It therefore appeared necessary to us to create this tool. The scale self-assessment of the fear that we have developed consists of six faces representing a gradual level of fear: the child can easily describe their level of fear, which allows for appropriate care.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of children who validate the 6 faces expressing fear.
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of children who validate the 6 faces expressing fear. The test will be validated if we get a result at least 60%.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of children who properly fit the faces expressing fear in ascending and descending order.

intervention.intervention_name: Placing a scale self-assessment of fear
intervention.description: Children spend a self-assessment scale of fear

study_pop.textblock: Participating in the study of children aged 4 to 12 years. In this study, participation of school children and hospitalized children

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Children aged 4 to 12 years.
- Enrolled in one of the participating institutions in the study (steps 1-5) or consultant pediatric emergencies at the Children of Limoges (step 6).
- Authorization of at least one person having parental authority for the child to participate in the study.
- Children affiliates or benefiting from a social security
Exclusion Criteria:
- Children with psychomotor disorders that prevent the use of the scale studied and understanding instructions.
- Children in vital emergency
